title: Worksheet 6: Drawing with Code
description: Learn to create visual patterns by drawing on a grid using coordinates.

problems.title: Your First Pixel
problems.content:
Welcome to grid drawing! You can color cells on a grid using the `draw()` function. The grid uses coordinates like a graph in math class: (x, y). The bottom-left corner is (0, 0).

Try running this code to see a single red cell appear!
problems.task: Run the code to draw a red cell at position (1, 1).
problems.starterCode:
use_canvas(GRID3)

# Draw a red cell in the center
draw(1, 1, 'red')
problems.hint: Just click 'Run Code' to see the cell appear on the canvas above!

problems.title: Draw a Horizontal Line
problems.content:
Now let's draw multiple cells to create a line. A horizontal line goes from left to right at the same y-coordinate.

The grid is 3Ã—3, so the coordinates go from (0, 0) to (2, 2). Let's draw a black line across the middle row at y=1.
problems.task: Draw a black horizontal line at y=1 by coloring cells (0, 1), (1, 1), and (2, 1).
problems.starterCode:
use_canvas(GRID3)

# Draw three cells to make a horizontal line
# draw(x, y) draws black by default
problems.hint: You need three draw() calls: draw(0, 1), draw(1, 1), and draw(2, 1)

problems.title: Color the Corners
problems.content:
Let's make a pattern by coloring the four corner cells of the grid. The corners are at coordinates: (0, 0), (2, 0), (0, 2), and (2, 2).

You can use different colors! Try 'blue', 'green', 'yellow', 'purple', or any color name you know.
problems.task: Draw blue cells in all four corners of the grid.
problems.starterCode:
use_canvas(GRID3)

# Color all four corners blue
problems.hint: You need four draw() calls for the corners: (0, 0), (2, 0), (0, 2), and (2, 2)
